title: The Moon or Bust
description: Mickey and his pal Freddy launch a home-made space ship to the moon. They land in outer space, but there are no moon men around only cows.

title: Disc Jockey
description: Mickey, moonlighting as a disc jockey, gets mixed up with a gang of crooks.

title: Double Trouble
description: Mickey is mistaken for a visiting French author.

title: Private Eye
description: Mickey becomes a private eye and the target of much attention from a gang of hoodlums.

title: The Grunion Hunt Mystery
description: A fishy character interrupts Mickey's plans for a grunion hunt with Pat.

title: Ghost Story
description: A haunting tale: Mickey's parents and boss are trying to rent the same cabin for their vacations when ghosts suddenly appear.

title: The Lion Hunt
description: Mickey and Freddy join a city-wide hunt for an escaped lion.

title: The Bronc Buster
description: Mickey's girl Pat falls for a tall Texan and Mickey goes West to win her back.

title: Tiger Mulligan
description: The betting is heavy when Mickey is picked to represent the network in a boxing match but most of the wagers are placed on his opponent.

title: The Other Woman
description: Mickey shows some home movies which include a scene of his boss embracing a beautiful women. When his wife threatens to his supervisor, Mickey and Freddy decide to pretend to be Arab princes to lure the 'other woman' away.

title: Diamond in the Rough
description: Undaunted by his lack of golf skills, Mickey enters the company's annual tournament to take a shot at its top prize of 50 dollars. A pair of jewel thieves grabs a valuable diamond and hides the jewel in Mickey's golf ball.

title: The Executive
description: Mickey learns that his size may be impeding his growth in the business world.

title: The Seance
description: Mrs. Mulligan falls under the influence of a spiritualist who tells her to sell the family house.

title: The Voice
description: An injection cures Mickey's laryngitis and gives him a fabulous singing voice.

title: Fan Mail
description: The network brass has Mickey's boss on the carpet for a low-rated show.

title: Scoop Mulligan
description: A newspaper job gives Mickey a chance to prove his journalistic prowess or lack of it.

title: The Fur Coat
description: Loving son Mickey wants to surprise his mother with a fur coat so he starts raising chinchillas.

title: The Basketball Star
description: Mickey tries out for the company basketball team in trick shoes.

title: The Wedding Present
description: Network employees chip in for a wedding gift and choose Mickey to buy it.

title: Mickey and the Mummy
description: An Egyptian mummy is an unexpected source of help as Mickey tries to apprehend jewel smugglers.

title: Seven Days to Doom
description: Mickey learns that he has only seven days to live.

title: Cinderella Nell
description: Joy and bedlam reign: Mrs. Mulligan has won a giant TV jackpot.

title: Star Struck
description: Mickey is assigned to escort movie queen Mona Sanders around the TV studio.

title: The Average Man
description: The network launches a search for the average TV viewer.

title: Friends and Foes
description: Best friends for 21 years and the friendship ends when Mickey and Freddy argue over when they met.

title: The Producer
description: Mickey unwittingly hires a chimp to star in the company show.

title: Society Woman
description: A socialite visits the Mulligans to take part in a charity for underprivileged children but is quick to leave after hearing Mulligan's 23rd precinct harmonics.

title: The Giant Killer
description: Roped into babysitting, Mulligan tells his version of the fable, "Jack and the Beanstalk".

title: The Surplus Store
description: Confident of their business ability, Mickey and Freddy buy a war-surplus store.

title: The Guardian
description: Mickey becomes the guardian of a beautiful "baby" and her huge inheritance.

title: The Robot
description: Mickey orders some Government surplus computers and receives a robot instead.
